phase. The factor group analysis predicts 3A 1 + 3E + 3F 1 + 6F 2 Brillouin zone centre optic modes there, out of which 3A 1 + 3E are nonpolar Raman active modes and 6F 2 are simultaneously Raman and IR active modes. Previous single crystal spectroscopic and theory investigations
14 allowed us to estimate frequencies of all its Raman active modes. For the purpose of the grain orientation analysis, it is practical to inspect well separated and strongly scattering modes, such as the A 1 phonon mode near 277 cm −1 and the E phonon mode near 330 cm −1 (see Fig. 1).
